events.name: Running Docker containers in production made easy with Kontena
events.description:
Hello Singapore! Join us to kick-start Kontena Singapore Meetup! We'll have an intro to Kontena container & microservices platform and a hands-on live demo. Terry Lee from Noggin will also talk about Realtime Provisioning of Personal Data Services using Kontena. Kontena is the most developer-friendly container and microservices platform that works on any cloud, on-premise or hybrid, and is extremely easy to use. It is designed for devs and ops who don't want to create a platform of their own or hassle with overly complicated platforms. Kontena comes with all batteries included: orchestration & scheduling, networking, image registry, secrets management, load balancing, automatic updates and lot more. It has everything needed to run your containers & microservices in production giving you peace of mind. Venue to be advised. Agenda 18.00 Arrive & socialize w snacks & drinks 18.15 Introduction to Kontena Container Management Platform (Miska Kaipiainen, Kontena, Inc.)  * What is Kontena and why would you care * How to install Kontena and deploy your first app *  Demos & use cases Realtime Provision of Personal Data Services using Kontena (Terry Lee, Noggin) Noggin's technical problem statement and why Kontena was picked. * How they use Kontena * Tips and Tricks 19.30 Q&A & more socializing 20.00 Meetup closing 


Presenter Bios  * Miska Kaipiainen is the CEO and founder of Kontena, the creator of the Kontena open source, developer-friendly container platform that was recognized by Black Duck as one of the Top 10 Open Source Rookies of the Year 2015. A serial entrepreneur and business developer, he has extensive experience in managing high-tech businesses in both the hardware and software sectors. Twitter: @miskakai. * Terry Lee is a production engineer at Noggin Asia, currently responsible for developing a secure personal data platform for the Individual. He believes that the world is moving from corporate-centric systems to one based on the Internet-of-Me, hence his current venture. He likes to use innovative but practical technologies to solve daily challenges. You will find him writing systems in Ruby, Scala and Elixir, all of which he deploys to a Kontena grid. Looking forward to seeing you! PS. We are looking for people who could help us organizing these meetups in the future. If you think you could help us, please let us know!
events.location: Cliftons Singapore - Finexis Building  , 108 Robinson Road Level 11, 068900

events.name: Corda Singapore's First Meetup - Identity use case
events.description: Welcome to our very own meetup group for Corda! We are excited to host R3's Corda Enterprise Lead Mike Ward who is visiting Singapore from Sydney. Mike will present R3's Corda for the local business and technical community. Corda is an open-sourced distributed ledger platform designed from the ground up to record, manage and synchronise financial agreements between regulated financial institutions. It is heavily inspired by and captures the benefits of blockchain systems, without the design choices that make blockchains inappropriate for many banking scenarios. Schedule 6:15pm - 7pm Arrive, relax, and mingle 7pm - 7:45pm Identity on a distributed ledger The topic of Identity in financial services is one of the great issues of the day. Governments and regulators alike have the bit between their teeth in terms of holding the financial industry to account for any financial crime admitted through their infrastructures. The unstoppable trend to digitalisation of services only increases the channels and traffic that must be monitored as well as the opportunities for criminals to hide their activity behind bogus or genuine identities. Ever increasing compliance requirements are the norm, along with associated fines for non-compliance, and yet banks have very few new tools with which to effectively identify and prevent criminal or unethical activity, from both external and internal sources. Distributed ledgers, with cryptographic securing of records built into their DNA, are a natural place to look for new solutions.  7:45pm - 8pm Q & A Please check back here for any updates.
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore 038985, ThanksGiving Room

events.name: HackerNest Singapore February 2017 Tech Social
events.description: HackerNest Tech Socials are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech community. Atmosphere: chill, friendly, unpretentious, agenda-free (no sales pitch), and brimming with Ultra Smart People.  Follow us on Twitter and Instagram, like us on Facebook, hi-5 us in person! The typical Tech Social agenda:   - folks arrive, grab drinks, socialize   - quick announcements, thank sponsors   - back to chatting   - head home, exhilarated from great conversations!   *** VENUE:  DBS Bank, recently acknowledged as the World’s Best Digital Bank, today officially opened DBS Asia X (DAX). Located at the Sandcrawler Building in Fusionopolis, DAX is a 16,000 sq ft innovation space that has project pods and spaces, journey rooms, co-working spaces for up to 100 people as well as an auditorium and cafe. Join us for a fun event and learn more about the Fintech initiatives at DAX. Specifically: A. Programs they will be running – Where founders may find business opportunities to work with DBS B. Jobs they will be filling – People looking for work opportunities, eg Fintech support, Research. Job descriptions are available under DBS > Innovation group DBS would like to hear your ideas, so please bring thoughts to the table!  *** COMMUNITY PARTNER: https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/rVmaLfgG-xe9EneBmR2bRkz53H2oglyvddiwtyiScZGIU1l_8pN4niQEabgbmy4HZThgvwYU9jzRNElbUG2Hew7k-n5bWb7VraKlRh5pMUKbT6dDVt7hkRknvHNQfv7Ku0rzzwyg InternSG connect passionate learners to budding entrepreneurs and businesses for work experiences. They endeavor to support communities organisation like HackerNest to pool like-minded individuals with multidisciplinary skills in solving real world problems. If you’re a Community or Meetup group looking to promote an event or discount for HackerNest members, please email [masked]. About us: </a><a href="http://hackernest.com/">HackerNest is an international nonprofit uniting local tech communities through unpretentious Tech Socials and hackathons. We cram lots of smart, accomplished people into a room and get them talking to one another. Our relaxed, down-to-earth events attract a diverse and highly technical membership. Strict 'no-scuzzbag' policy. Want to volunteer at our HackerNest Tech Socials? Visit http://hackernest.com/volunteer/ for more information and to apply!
events.location: DBS Asia X (DAX), Sandcrawler Building - 1 Fusionopolis View, #07-03, Singapore 138577

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:45p - Introduce projects from members6:55p - Break out into groups7:00p - Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

We welcome any CSS-related topics at ANY level because we’re all here to learn and share. :)
